page.title: 06Scotter Parish Council
page.content: According to population Scotter is entitled to{12}councillors,but only has{10}- 8 men,2 women.The majority of the council are long serving members. Meetings and elections are held according to the{Local Government Act {1972}.The council meets in the village hall on the 3rd Monday of each month. For the last 20 years they have met in the waiting room of the doctor's surgery.The original meeting place,the village institute,was too cold in winter.Councillors are not paid but the{clerk}receives expenses of Â£1000 a year for correspondence.An additional rate is levied within the parish to maintain the dykes which carry land water into the River Eau.Scotter is one of only 3 parishes in the country which does this. The council is not connected to any political party.
